title: refactor(simple): extract magic numbers in SocketSimple-reconnect.c policy defaults
body:
## Summary
The `Socket_simple_reconnect_policy_defaults()` function in `src/simple/SocketSimple-reconnect.c` contains 9 hardcoded magic numbers for policy configuration defaults.

## Location
**File**: `src/simple/SocketSimple-reconnect.c`  
**Lines**: 58-66  
**Function**: `Socket_simple_reconnect_policy_defaults()`

## Issue
```c
void
Socket_simple_reconnect_policy_defaults (SocketSimple_Reconnect_Policy *policy)
{
  if (!policy)
    return;

  policy->initial_delay_ms = 100;        // Magic number
  policy->max_delay_ms = 30000;          // Magic number
  policy->multiplier = 2.0;              // Magic number
  policy->jitter = 0.25;                 // Magic number
  policy->max_attempts = 10;             // Magic number
  policy->circuit_threshold = 5;         // Magic number
  policy->circuit_reset_ms = 60000;      // Magic number
  policy->health_interval_ms = 30000;    // Magic number
  policy->health_timeout_ms = 5000;      // Magic number
}
```

## Recommendation
Define named constants for these default values to improve maintainability and clarify intent:

```c
/* Default reconnection policy values */
#define RECONNECT_DEFAULT_INITIAL_DELAY_MS    100
#define RECONNECT_DEFAULT_MAX_DELAY_MS        30000
#define RECONNECT_DEFAULT_MULTIPLIER          2.0
#define RECONNECT_DEFAULT_JITTER              0.25
#define RECONNECT_DEFAULT_MAX_ATTEMPTS        10
#define RECONNECT_DEFAULT_CIRCUIT_THRESHOLD   5
#define RECONNECT_DEFAULT_CIRCUIT_RESET_MS    60000
#define RECONNECT_DEFAULT_HEALTH_INTERVAL_MS  30000
#define RECONNECT_DEFAULT_HEALTH_TIMEOUT_MS   5000
```

## Benefits
- Eliminates magic numbers
- Makes values easier to update consistently
- Improves code documentation
- Follows C Anti-Patterns guide in CLAUDE.md

## Pattern
Pattern ID: `MAGIC_POLICY_DEFAULTS`  
Category: Redundancy  
Severity: HIGH

## Related
See CLAUDE.md "C Anti-Patterns and Fixes" section on Magic Numbers.
